1.text: From inside the fish, Jonah prayed to the LORD his God,

2.text: saying: “In my distress I called to the LORD, and He answered me. From the belly of Sheol I called for help, and You heard my voice.

3.text: For You cast me into the deep, into the heart of the seas, and the current swirled about me; all Your breakers and waves swept over me.

4.text: At this, I said, ‘I have been banished from Your sight; yet I will look once more toward Your holy temple.’

5.text: The waters engulfed me to take my life; the watery depths closed around me; the seaweed wrapped around my head.

6.text: To the roots of the mountains I descended; the earth beneath me barred me in forever! But You raised my life from the pit, O LORD my God!

7.text: As my life was fading away, I remembered the LORD. My prayer went up to You, to Your holy temple.

8.text: Those who cling to worthless idols forsake His loving devotion.

9.text: But I, with the voice of thanksgiving, will sacrifice to You. I will fulfill what I have vowed. Salvation is from the LORD!”

10.text: And the LORD commanded the fish, and it vomited Jonah onto dry land.
